
An old spy agency reused primes of special form in RSA. Crack the message: 1613313570708708699767612576914558689475003002201854436648608375553017068788238411157828115392263600589510483115121737970089509424151411846649820229778614 and reveal the secret.


The flag format is flag{...}
n=5056984808483409073834220530170201936015091820903618154913977209788219958610616838418004557624551835044703241026565032118758643499840558825875015483574761, e=1141964639146746535485738082348994202763467202498024629361495178469532049979171970175669256970342399266439111416617562582839300242994100969086177447509643
The lower 104 bits of p are: 46821624694192903183373739498311556755


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{phbsw5g0}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1613313570708708699767612576914558689475003002201854436648608375553017068788238411157828115392263600589510483115121737970089509424151411846649820229778614
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5056984808483409073834220530170201936015091820903618154913977209788219958610616838418004557624551835044703241026565032118758643499840558825875015483574761, e=1141964639146746535485738082348994202763467202498024629361495178469532049979171970175669256970342399266439111416617562582839300242994100969086177447509643
The lower 104 bits of p are: 46821624694192903183373739498311556755

extra_info: p=86042186157348303416225596145654541162496125093881544994631623163697485094547, q=58773318465380774114281940242081852372340155564492484163655957108917905458963, Ï†(n)=5056984808483409073834220530170201936015091820903618154913977209788219958610472022913381828547021327508315504633030195838100269470682271245602400093021252
